description:
Critical Reading > Sentence Completions

Choose the word or set of words that, when inserted in the sentence, best fits the meaning of the sentence as a whole.

Currently rising temperatures in the Arctic and Antarctic are ------- of a still warmer world that could result from an excess of atmospheric carbon dioxide produced by the burning of oil, gas, and coal.

(A) polarities

(B) harbingers

(C) vestiges

(D) counterexamples

(E) aftereffects

正确答案>>>

description:
"Tactics, fitness, stroke ability, adaptability, experience, and sportsmanship are all necessary for winning." -Fred Perry“策略、健康、适应力、经验和体育精神都是成功的必要条件。”——弗莱德·派瑞

"It is not the strongest or the most intelligent who will survive but those who can best manage change." -Charles Darwin“生存下来的不是那些最强壮或最聪明的，而是那些适应力最好的。”——查尔斯·达尔文

"The art of life is a constant readjustment to our surroundings." -Kakuzo Okakaura“生活的艺术在于对周遭环境的不断调整。”——冈仓天心

"Adaptability is not imitation. It means power of resistance and assimilation."-Mahatma Gandhi“适应不是模仿。它体现了抵抗和同化的力量。”——圣雄甘地

"People will try to tell you that all the great opportunities have been snapped up. In reality, the world changes every second, blowing new opportunities in all directions, including yours." -Ken Hakuta“人们会告诉你所有好机会都没了。事实上，世界瞬息万变，到处都有新机会，包括你的机会。”——肯哈谷达

"Learn to adjust yourself to the conditions you have to endure, but make a point of trying to alter or correct conditions so that they are most favorable to you." -William Frederick Book“学会在你必须忍受的环境中调整自己，但试着改变或纠正它们，让它们对你最有利。”——威廉·弗雷德里克

"All fixed set patterns are incapable of adaptability or pliability. The truth is outside of all fixed patterns." - Bruce Lee“所有固定的模式都不能调整或变通。真相在固定模式之外。”——李小龙

"A wise man adapts himself to circumstances, as water shapes itself to the vessel that contains it." -Chinese Proverb“明智的人会根据情况调整自己，就像水会根据容器的形状改变形态。”——中国谚语

"Fall seven times and stand up eight." -Japanese Proverb“就算跌倒七次也要在第八次站起来”——日本谚语

"When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be."-Lao Tzu“当我不再拘泥于自己是谁时，我变成了自己想成为的人。”——老子

"You can't fall if you don't climb. But there's no joy in living your whole life on the ground."- Unknown“如果你不爬就不会跌倒。但在地面上的人生毫无乐趣。”——佚名

description:
每年的英语专业四级考试中，写作都是重要的组成部分，为了更好地应对专四写作，下面就为大家带来英语专四的写作范文，希望能够对考生的写作有所帮助。

More and more college students complain that graduation means the coming of unemployment. What advice will you give to the undergraduates to avoid this dilemma?

Write on ANSWER SHEET THREE a composition of about 200 words.

You are to write in three parts.

In the first part, state specifically what your view is.

In the second part, support your view with appropriate details.

In the last part, bring what you have written to a natural conclusion or a summary.

You should supply an appropriate title for your composition.

Marks will be awarded for content, organization, grammar and appropriateness. Failure to follow the instructions may result in a loss of marks.

范文

My Advice to the Undergraduates

Because of the severe competition in the job market, it's quite difficult to get a decent job for a college graduate. Many college students complain that graduation means the coming of unemployment. To avoid this dilemma, I have some advice to the undergraduates.

To avoid unemployment after graduation, the undergraduates have to prepare themselves for the job-hunting long before their graduation. First, study as hard as you can. Surely an applicant with more high marks in his resume will be more likely to get a job. And a hard-working student can acquire more knowledge and pass interviews easily. Second, get a part-time job which is related to the job you want to get in the future. Many college students like to find a part-time job, but most of them do this only for pocket money. Can this part-time job be written into your resume as a related job experience? Can this part-time job bring you new friends who are doing the very kind of job you want to do after graduation? Think it over and make full use of your part-time job.

If the undergraduates prepare themselves well for the job-hunting, they will have more chances to find a good job after graduation.
